<kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Hi Ye, 

Ideally take a look at first to sanity check the code, and if possible an ongoing audit/communication channel for the cases where the cryptography changes leading upto the start of the ceremony. 

A formal audit of the cryptography would be great, but there is one already planned with sigma prime, so its not a high priority imo. author: bridge-bot
content:
<Recmo> Agree, the main concern is getting everything ready by devcon. We'd like some skilled eyes to go over the code and see if they spot any issues. Both in crypto parts and in server parts. More sanity check than formal audit.

Main goal is to build enough confidence in the codebase that we are okay with launching it by devcon, even if we are still waiting for the formal audit to complete. So remaining issues that can be fixed post-launch and don't cause huge embarishment should be ok, but we'd rather not have the ceremony corrupted or the website defaced.
